bill.title: An Act Relating To Restoring Solvency To The Unemployment Trust Fund
bill.description: An Act Relating To Restoring Solvency To The Unemployment Trust Fund

history.action: Committed to the Committee on Finance on motion of Senator Mazza
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Campbell
Read second time, reported favorably with recommendation of amendment by Senator Cummings for Committee on Finance
Recommendation of amendment by Committee on Finance agreed to
Recommendation of amendment by Senator(s) Illuzzi, text
Recommendation of amendment agreed to
Recommendation of amendment by Senator(s) Ashe, Illuzzi, and Scott, text
Senator(s) Nitka and Campbell moved to amend motion to amend offered by Senators Ashe, Illuzzi and Scott, which was agreed to
Recommendation of amendment of Senator(s) Ashe, Illuzzi, and Scott, as amended, agreed to
Recommendation of amendment by Senator(s) Racine and Mazza, text
Recommendation of amendment agreed to
Recommendation of amendment by Senator(s) Cummings, text
Recommendation of amendment agreed to
3rd reading ordered
Rules suspended & bill placed on all remaining stages of passage, on motion of Senator Shumlin
Read 3rd time & passed on roll call, requested by Senator Sears, Passed -- Needed 14 of 26 to Pass -- Yeas = 26, Nays = 0
As passed by Senate
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Shumlin
Read First Time and Referred to the Committee on Commerce and Economic Development
Rules Suspended and Taken up for Immediate Consideration as moved by Rep. Komline of Dorset
Referred to Committee on Ways and Means per Rule 35(a)
Rep. Nease of Johnson moved to suspend rules and take up bill for immediate consideration
Motion for rules suspension as moved by Rep. Nease of Johnson disagreed to
Rep. Komline of Dorset demanded yeas and nays
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 102 of 135 to Pass -- Yeas = 86, Nays = 49
Rules Suspended and Taken up for Immediate Consideration as moved by Rep. Komline of Dorset
Read Second Time
Rep. Marcotte of Coventry spoke for the committee on Commerce and Economic Development
Rep. Sharpe of Bristol, recommended for the committee on Ways and Means
Rep. Davis of Washington, Poirier of Barre City, and Zuckerman of Burlington moved to amend the bill
Pending the question, shall the Proposal of Amendment be amended as offered by Rep. Davis of Washington, Poirier of Barre City, and Zuckerman of Burlington, the question was divided
Second Instance of amendment disagreed to
Rep. Poirier of Barre City demanded yeas and nays
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 69 of 137 to Pass -- Yeas = 24, Nays = 113
Third Instance of amendment disagreed to
Rep. Davis of Washington demanded yeas and nays
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 70 of 139 to Pass -- Yeas = 16, Nays = 123
First Instance of amendment disagreed to
Rep. Zuckerman of Burlington demanded yeas and nays
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 71 of 140 to Pass -- Yeas = 19, Nays = 121
Third Reading Ordered
Rep. Marcotte of Coventry demanded yeas and nays
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 72 of 142 to Pass -- Yeas = 133, Nays = 9
Rules suspended and bill placed in all remaining stages of passage as moved by Rep. Komline of Dorset
Read Third time and Passed in Concurrence
Rules suspended and bill messaged forthwith to the Senate as moved by Rep. Komline of Dorset
House message House passed bill in concurrence
As passed by Senate and House
Delivered to Governor on May 19, 2010
Signed by Governor on May 24, 2010
